Varenberg Bianca Bree Nicholas Van Varenberg |religion = Roman
Catholic }} 'Jean-Claude Camille FranÃ§ois Van Varenberg' (born 18 October 1960),
professionally known as 'Jean-Claude Van Damme', . is a Belgian
martial artist, actor, and director best known for his martial arts
action films. The most successful of these films include [[Bloodsport
(film)|Bloodsport]] (1988), [[Kickboxer (film)|Kickboxer]] (1989), [[Universal
Soldier (1992 film)|Universal Soldier]] (1992), [[Hard Target]] (1993), [[Street
Fighter (film)|Street Fighter]] (1994), [[Timecop (film)|Timecop]] (1994),
[[Sudden Death (film)|Sudden Death]] (1995), [[JCVD]] (2008) and [[The
Expendables 2]] (2012).

After studying martial arts intensively from the age of ten, Van Damme achieved
national success in Belgium as a martial artist and bodybuilder, earning the
"Mr. Belgium" bodybuilding title. He emigrated to the
United States in 1982 to pursue a career in film, and achieved success with
Bloodsport (1988), based on a story written by Frank Dux. He attained subsequent
box office success with Timecop (1994), which was his highest grossing film with
over $100 million.
categories: Belgian emigrants to the United States
